source: No sabemos bien por qu sucede eso.

source: Entonces, hay muchas variedades de sexo.

source: El sistema se basa normalmente en la idea de que una anatoma particular trae aparejada una identidad particular.

translation_hypothesis: The system is normally based on the idea that a particular anatoma brings with it a particular identity.

source: Tenemos la idea de que ser mujer es tener identidad femenina; supuestamente, ser negro quiere decir tener anatoma africana en trminos histricos.
translation_reference: So we have the concept that what it means to be a woman  is to have a female identity;  what it means to be a black person is, allegedly,  is to have an African anatomy  in terms of your history.

source: Una idea terriblemente simplista.

source: Y cuando se nos presenta un cuerpo que muestra algo bastante diferente, tenemos problemas con la categorizacin.

source: De modo que tenemos ideas muy romnticas en nuestra cultura respecto al individualismo.

source: Imaginen lo sorprendente que es tener hijos que nacen como dos personas dentro de un mismo cuerpo.

source: El caso reciente ms lgido es del ao pasado con la corredora sudafricana Caster Semenya; se puso en tela de juicio su sexo en los Juegos Internacionales de Berln.
translation_reference: Where I ran into the most heat from this most recently  was last year the South African runner, Caster Semenya,  had her sex called into question at the International Games in Berlin.

source: Muchos periodistas llamaron para preguntarme: "Qu examen van a realizar para determinar si Caster Semenya es hombre o mujer?".

source: De hecho, ahora sabemos que el sexo es tan complicado que tenemos que admitir que la Naturaleza no traza una lnea tajante entre hombres y mujeres o entre hombres e intersexuales y mujeres e intersexuales; somos nosotros quienes trazamos esa lnea.
translation_reference: In fact, we now know  that sex is complicated enough  that we have to admit  nature doesn't draw the line for us between male and female,  or between male and intersex and female and intersex;  we actually draw that line on nature.

source: As, lo que tenemos es una situacin en la que cuanto ms avanza la ciencia, ms tenemos que admitir que estas categoras (que pensbamos eran categoras anatmicas estables que se correspondan directamente con categoras identitarias estables) son mucho ms difusas de lo que pensbamos.
translation_reference: So what we have is a sort of situation  where the farther our science goes,  the more we have to admit to ourselves  that these categories  that we thought of as stable anatomical categories  that mapped very simply  to stable identity categories  are a lot more fuzzy than we thought.

source: Y no slo en trminos de sexo.

translation_hypothesis: And not only in terms of sex.

source: Tambin en trminos de raza, algo que resulta mucho ms complicado de lo que la terminologa permite.
translation_reference: It's also in terms of race,  which turns out to be vastly more complicated  than our terminology has allowed.

source: Como vemos, nos metemos en un terreno escabroso.
translation_reference: As we look, we get into all sorts of uncomfortable areas.
translation_hypothesis: As we can see, we get into a rough terrain.

source: Miremos, por ejemplo, el hecho de que compartimos al menos el 95% del ADN con los chimpancs.
translation_reference: We look, for example, about the fact  that we share at least 95 percent of our DNA  with chimpanzees.
translation_hypothesis: Let us look, for example, at the fact that we share at least 95% of DNA with chimpancs.

source: Qu opinaremos del hecho de diferir de ellos en slo unos pocos nucletidos?

source: Y a medida que progresamos en la ciencia nos metemos cada vez ms en una zona incmoda en la que tenemos que reconocer que las categoras simplistas que manejbamos probablemente son demasiado simplistas.
translation_reference: And as we get farther and farther with our science,  we get more and more into a discomforted zone  where we have to acknowledge  that the simplistic categories we've had  are probably overly simplistic.
translation_hypothesis: And as we progress in science we get more and more into an uncompromising area where we have to recognize that the simplistic categories we handle are probably too simplistic.

source: Y estamos observando esto en todos los mbitos de la vida humana.

source: Uno de ellos, por ejemplo, en nuestra cultura actual, en los EE. UU. de hoy, son las luchas al principio y al fin de la vida.
translation_reference: One of the places we're seeing it, for example,  in our culture today, in the United States today,  is battles over the beginning of life and the end of life.

source: Es difcil fijar un momento a partir del cual un cuerpo se torna humano y tiene derechos diferentes a los de los fetos.

source: Hay discusiones muy acaloradas hoy en da -quiz no en pblico, pero s dentro de la medicina- respecto a cundo alguien se considera muerto.
translation_reference: We have very difficult conversations nowadays --  probably not out in the open as much as within medicine --  about the question of when somebody's dead.

source: Nuestros antepasados nunca tuvieron que vrselas con esta cuestin de si alguien estaba muerto.
translation_reference: In the past, our ancestors never had to struggle so much  with this question of when somebody was dead.
translation_hypothesis: Our ancestors never had to dress them with this question of whether anyone was dead.

source: Como mucho le ponan una pluma delante de la nariz y si se mova todava no lo enterraban.

source: Si dejaba de moverse lo enterraban.

source: Pero hoy podemos, por ejemplo, extraer rganos vitales de un cuerpo y ponerlos en otro cuerpo.

source: Y, como consecuencia, debemos enfrentarnos al dilema de determinar realmente la muerte de alguien. Y esto nos coloca en una situacin difcil en la que no tenemos las categoras simples del pasado.
translation_reference: And as a consequence,  we're stuck with having to struggle with this really difficult question  about who's dead,  and this leads us to a really difficult situation  where we don't have such simple categories as we've had before.

source: Y quiz piensen que esta explosin de categoras podra alegrar a alguien como yo.

source: En poltica soy progresista, defiendo a las personas con cuerpos inusuales, pero tengo que admitir que me pone nerviosa.

source: Tensa desde el punto de vista del concepto de democracia.

source: S que eran racistas, s que eran sexistas, pero eran grandes.
translation_reference: I know they were racists, I know they were sexist,  but they were great.

source: Quiero decir, eran tan valientes y audaces y tan radicales en lo que hicieron, que me encuentro cada tanto viendo ese musical cursi "1776" y no por la msica, que es totalmente pasable.
translation_reference: I mean, they were so brave and so bold  and so radical in what they did  that I find myself watching that cheesy musical "1776" every few years,  and it's not because of the music, which is totally forgettable.
translation_hypothesis: I mean, they were so brave and bold and so radical in what they did, that I find myself every so often watching that cheesy musical "1776" and not for the music, which is totally passable.

source: Es por lo que ocurri en 1776 con los Padres Fundadores.
translation_reference: It's because of what happened in 1776  with the Founding Fathers.
translation_hypothesis: That is why it happened in 1776 with the Founding Fathers.

source: Los Padres Fundadores fueron, para m, los primeros activistas de la anatoma y les explico por qu.
translation_reference: The Founding Fathers were, for my point of view,  the original anatomical activists,  and this is why.
translation_hypothesis: The Founding Fathers were, to me, the first activists of the anatoma and I explain why.

source: Lo que ellos rechazaban era un concepto anatmico y lo reemplazaban con otro que era radical y hermoso y se mantuvo durante 200 aos.
translation_reference: What they rejected was an anatomical concept  and replaced it with another one  that was radical and beautiful and held us for 200 years.
translation_hypothesis: What they rejected was an anatomical concept and replaced it with another one that was radical and beautiful and remained for 200 years.

source: Y, como todos recuerdan, lo que rechazaban nuestros Padres Fundadores era la idea de la monarqua. La monarqua se basaba en un concepto muy simplista de la anatoma.
translation_reference: So as you all recall,  what our Founding Fathers were rejecting was a concept of monarchy,  and the monarchy was basically based  on a very simplistic concept of anatomy.
translation_hypothesis: And, as everyone remembers, what our Founding Fathers rejected was the idea of monarqua. Monarqua was based on a very simplistic concept of anatoma.

source: Los monarcas del viejo mundo no conocan el ADN, pero tenan clara la idea de derecho de nacimiento.
translation_reference: The monarchs of the old world  didn't have a concept of DNA,  but they did have a concept of birthright.
translation_hypothesis: The monarchs of the old world do not know DNA, but they have a clear idea of birthright.

source: Tenan el concepto de sangre azul.
translation_reference: They had a concept of blue blood.
translation_hypothesis: They have the concept of blue blood.

source: Eran de la idea de que se llegaba al poder poltico por el derecho de sangre transmitido del abuelo al padre y luego al hijo, etc.
translation_reference: They had the idea that the people who would be in political power  should be in political power  because of the blood being passed down  from grandfather to father to son and so forth.
translation_hypothesis: They were of the idea that political power was reached by the blood right transmitted from grandfather to father and then to son, etc.

source: Los Padres Fundadores rechazaron esa idea y la reemplazaron por un nuevo concepto anatmico y ese concepto era que todos los hombres son creados iguales.
translation_reference: The Founding Fathers rejected that idea,  and they replaced it with a new anatomical concept,  and that concept  was all men are created equal.
translation_hypothesis: The Founding Fathers rejected that idea and replaced it with a new anatomical concept and that concept was that all men are created equal.

source: Ellos nivelaron el campo de juego y decidieron que la anatoma que importaba era la anatoma en comn y no las diferencias anatmicas. Eso fue algo muy radical.
translation_reference: They leveled that playing field  and decided the anatomy that mattered  was the commonality of anatomy,  not the difference in anatomy,  and that was a really radical thing to do.
translation_hypothesis: They leveled the playing field and decided that the anatoma that mattered was the anatoma in comn and not the anatomical differences. That was a very radical thing.

source: Y en parte lo estaban haciendo porque formaban parte de un sistema ilustrado en el que se estaban gestando dos cosas.
translation_reference: Now they were doing it in part  because they were part of an Enlightenment system  where two things were growing up together.
translation_hypothesis: And in part they were doing it because they were part of an illustrated system in which two things were being developed.

source: Se estaba gestando la democracia y al mismo tiempo naca la ciencia.
translation_reference: And that was democracy growing up,  but it was also science growing up at the same time.
translation_hypothesis: Democracy was developing and at the same time science was born.

source: Y queda muy claro, si nos fijamos en la historia de los Padres Fundadores, que muchos estaban muy interesados en la ciencia y en la idea de un mundo naturalista.
translation_reference: And it's really clear, if you look at the history of the Founding Fathers,  a lot of them were very interested in science,  and they were interested in a concept  of a naturalistic world.
translation_hypothesis: And it is very clear, if we look at the history of the Founding Fathers, that many were very interested in science and the idea of a naturalistic world.

source: Se estaban distanciando de las explicaciones sobrenaturales y por ende rechazaban el concepto de poder sobrenatural transmitido por va de una idea vaga de derecho de nacimiento.
translation_reference: They were moving away from supernatural explanations,  and they were rejecting things like a supernatural concept of power,  where it transmitted  because of a very vague concept of birthright.
translation_hypothesis: They were distanced from supernatural explanations and thus rejected the concept of supernatural power transmitted by va from a vague idea of birthright.

source: Se estaban moviendo hacia un concepto naturalista.
translation_reference: They were moving towards a naturalistic concept.
translation_hypothesis: They were moving towards a naturalistic concept.

source: Y si miramos, por ejemplo, la Declaracin de la Independencia, hablan de la Naturaleza y del dios de la Naturaleza.
translation_reference: And if you look, for example, in the Declaration of Independence,  they talk about nature and nature's God.
translation_hypothesis: And if we look, for example, at the Declaration of Independence, they talk about Nature and the god of Nature.

source: No hablan de Dios y de la naturaleza de Dios.
translation_reference: They don't talk about God and God's nature.
translation_hypothesis: They do not speak of God and the nature of God.

source: Hablan del poder de la Naturaleza para decirnos quines somos.
translation_reference: They're talking about the power of nature  to tell us who we are.
translation_hypothesis: They talk about the power of nature to tell us who we are.

source: Y en consecuencia nos estaban transmitiendo la idea de la coincidencia anatmica.
translation_reference: So as part of that,  they were coming to us with a concept  that was about anatomical commonality.
translation_hypothesis: And consequently they were transmitting to us the idea of anatmic coincidence.

source: Y, al hacerlo, estaban sentando las bases del futuro movimiento de Derechos Civiles.
translation_reference: And in doing so, they were really setting up in a beautiful way  the Civil Rights movement of the future.
translation_hypothesis: And, in doing so, they were laying the foundation for the future Civil Rights movement.

source: No lo pensaron de ese modo, pero lo hicieron por nosotros y fue genial.
translation_reference: They didn't think of it that way, but they did it for us, and it was great.
translation_hypothesis: They didn't think so, but they did it for us and it was great.

source: Y qu sucedi aos despus?
translation_reference: So what happened years afterward?
translation_hypothesis: And what happened after?

source: Y las mujeres triunfaron.
translation_reference: And women successfully argued that.
translation_hypothesis: And the women triumphed.

source: Luego vino el xito del movimiento de los Derechos Civiles con personas del calibre de Sojourner Truth, que deca: "No soy una mujer?".
translation_reference: Next came the successful Civil Rights movement,  where we found people like Sojourner Truth  talking about, "Ain't I a woman?"
translation_hypothesis: Then came the success of the Civil Rights movement with people of the caliber of Sojourner Truth, who says, "Am I not a woman?"

source: Encontramos hombres en las filas del movimiento de Derechos Civiles diciendo: "Soy un hombre".
translation_reference: We find men  on the marching lines of the Civil Rights movement  saying, "I am a man."
translation_hypothesis: We found men in the ranks of the Civil Rights movement saying, "I'm a man."

source: De nuevo, gente de color que apelaba a la coincidencia anatmica sobre la diferencia anatmica y, de nuevo, triunfaron.
translation_reference: Again, people of color  appealing to a commonality of anatomy over a difference of anatomy,  again, successfully.
translation_hypothesis: Again, people of color who appealed to anatmic coincidence over anatmic difference and, again, triumphed.

source: Vemos lo mismo con el Movimiento de la Discapacidad.
translation_reference: We see the same thing with the disability rights movement.
translation_hypothesis: We see the same with the Disability Movement.

source: El problema es, por supuesto, que a medida que miramos las coincidencias tenemos que empezar a preguntarnos por qu mantenemos ciertas divisiones.
translation_reference: The problem is, of course,  that, as we begin to look at all that commonality,  we have to begin to question  why we maintain certain divisions.
translation_hypothesis: The problem is, of course, that as we look at coincidences we have to start wondering why we maintain certain divisions.

source: Pero, atencin, yo quiero mantener algunas divisiones anatmicas en nuestra cultura.
translation_reference: Now mind you, I want to maintain some divisions,  anatomically, in our culture.
translation_hypothesis: But, attention, I want to maintain some anatomical divisions in our culture.

source: Por ejemplo: no quiero darle a un pez los mismos derechos que a un humano.
translation_reference: For example, I don't want  to give a fish the same rights as a human.
translation_hypothesis: For example, I don't want to give a fish the same rights as a human.

source: No quiero decir que debamos rendirnos ante la anatoma.
translation_reference: I don't want to say we give up entirely on anatomy.
translation_hypothesis: I don't mean to give up on the anatoma.

source: No quiero decir que a los nios de 5 aos se les deba permitir tener relaciones sexuales o casarse.
translation_reference: I don't want to say five-year-olds  should be allowed to consent to sex or consent to marry.
translation_hypothesis: I don't mean five-year-olds should be allowed to have sex or get married.

source: Hay algunas divisiones anatmicas que para m tienen sentido y que creo deberamos mantener.
translation_reference: So there are some anatomical divisions  that make sense to me and that I think we should retain.
translation_hypothesis: There are some anatomical divisions that make sense to me and that I think we should maintain.

source: Pero el desafo es tratar de descubrir cules son, por qu mantenerlas y si tienen sentido.
translation_reference: But the challenge is trying to figure out which ones they are  and why do we retain them and do they have meaning.
translation_hypothesis: But the challenge is to try to find out who they are, why keep them and if they make sense.

source: Bueno, volvamos a esos dos seres concebidos al principio de esta charla.
translation_reference: So let's go back to those two beings  conceived at the beginning of this talk.
translation_hypothesis: Well, let's go back to those two conceived beings at the beginning of this talk.

source: Tenemos dos seres, ambos concebidos a mediados de 1979 exactamente el mismo da.
translation_reference: We have two beings, both conceived  in the middle of 1979 on the exact same day.
translation_hypothesis: We have two beings, both conceived in mid-1979 exactly the same da.

source: Imaginemos que uno de ellos, Mary, naci 3 meses antes de tiempo: el 1 de junio de 1980.
translation_reference: Let's imagine one of them, Mary,  is born three months prematurely,  so she's born on June 1, 1980.

translation_hypothesis: What are you going to do with him?"

source: Y su hermano dijo: "Slo quiero poder hablar con Tony otra vez.
translation_reference: And his brother said, "I just want to be able to talk to Tony again.
translation_hypothesis: And his brother said, "I just want to be able to talk to Tony again.

source: Slo quiero poder comunicarme con l y que l sea capaz de comunicarse conmigo".
translation_reference: I just want to be able to communicate with him  and him to be able to communicate with me."
translation_hypothesis: I just want to be able to communicate with him and to be able to communicate with me."

source: Y yo le dije: "Un segundo, no es que -he visto a Stephen Hawking- no es que todas las personas con parlisis pueden comunicarse mediante esos aparatos?"
translation_reference: And I said, "Wait a second, isn't that -- I've seen Stephen Hawking --  don't all paralyzed people have the ability to communicate  via these devices?"
translation_hypothesis: And I said, "One second, isn't that -- I've seen Stephen Hawking -- isn't that all people with parlysis can communicate with those devices?"

source: Y l dijo: "No, a menos que seas alguien importante y tengas un seguro muy bueno no puedes en realidad hacerlo.
translation_reference: And he said, "No, unless you're in the upper echelon and  you've got really amazing insurance,  you can't actually do that.
translation_hypothesis: And he said, "No, unless you're someone important and you have very good insurance you can't actually do it.

source: Estos dispositivos no son asequibles para la gente".
translation_reference: These devices aren't accessible to people."
translation_hypothesis: These devices are not affordable for people."

source: Y yo le dije: "Bueno, cmo se comunican entonces?"
translation_reference: And I said, "Well, how do you actually communicate?"
translation_hypothesis: And I said, "Well, how do you communicate then?"

source: Alguien a visto la pelcula "La escafandra y la mariposa"?
translation_reference: Has everyone seen the movie "The Diving Bell and the Butterfly?"
translation_hypothesis: Someone's seen the film "The Scarf and the Butterfly"?

source: Se comunican de esa manera... le van marcando con el dedo.
translation_reference: That's how they communicate --  so run their finger along.
translation_hypothesis: They communicate that way... they mark his finger.

source: Le dije: "Eso es arcaico. Cmo puede ser?"
translation_reference: I said, "That's archaic. How can that be?"
translation_hypothesis: I said, "That's archaic. How can it be?"

source: As que me present con el solo deseo de entregar un cheque y en vez de eso firm un cheque que no tena la menor idea de cmo iba a cubrir.
translation_reference: So I showed up with the desire to just write a check,  and instead, I wrote a check  that I had no freaking idea how I was going to cash.
translation_hypothesis: So I showed up with just the desire to deliver a check and instead sign a check that didn't have the slightest idea of how I was going to cover.

source: Me compromet con su hermano y con su padre all en ese preciso momento, "Muy bien, este es el trato: Tony va a hablar, le vamos a construir una mquina, y vamos a encontrar una manera para que vuelva a hacer su arte otra vez.
translation_reference: I committed to his brother and his father right then and there --  I'm like, "All right, here's the deal:  Tony's going to speak, we're going to get him a machine,  and we're going to figure out a way for him to do his art again.
translation_hypothesis: I commit myself to his brother and his father all at that very moment, "All right, here's the deal: Tony is going to talk, we're going to build him a machine, and we're going to find a way for him to do his art again.

source: Porque es ridculo que alguien que tienen tanto en su interior no pueda comunicarlo".
translation_reference: Because it's a travesty that someone who still has all of that in him  isn't able to communicate it."
translation_hypothesis: Because it's ridiculous that someone who has so much inside can't communicate it."

source: As que habl en una conferencia un par de meses despus.
translation_reference: So I spoke at a conference a couple months after that.
translation_hypothesis: So I spoke at a conference a couple of months after.

source: Conoc a estos tipos llamados GRL "Graffiti Research Lab", que tienen una tecnologa que les permite proyectar una luz en cualquier superficie y entonces, con un puntero lser, dibujan sobre eso y registran el espacio negativo.
translation_reference: I met these guys called GRL,  Graffiti Research Lab,  and they have a technology  that allows them to project a light onto any surface  and then, with a laser pointer, draw on it,  and it just registers the negative space.
translation_hypothesis: I know these guys called GRL "Graffiti Research Lab", who have a technology that allows them to project a light on any surface and then, with an lser pointer, draw on it and record the negative space.

source: As que van por ah haciendo instalaciones de arte como sta.
translation_reference: So they go around and do art installations like this.
translation_hypothesis: So they go around doing art facilities like Sta.

source: Todas las cosas que aparecen, ellos dicen, son parte de un ciclo de la vida.
translation_reference: All the things that go up there, they said there's a life cycle.
translation_hypothesis: All things that appear, they say, are part of a cycle of life.

source: Primero empiezan con los rganos sexuales, luego con las malas palabras, despus con los ataques a Bush y, al final, la gente empieza a hacer arte.
translation_reference: First it starts with the sexual organs,  then it starts with cuss words,  then it was Bush slanders  and then people actually got to art.
translation_hypothesis: First they start with the sexual organs, then with the bad words, after the attacks on Bush and, in the end, people start making art.

source: Pero siempre hubo un ciclo de la vida en sus presentaciones.
translation_reference: But there was always a life cycle to their presentations.

source: Y as empez el viaje.
translation_reference: So that started the journey.

source: Y unos dos aos despus, cerca de un ao despus, luego de mucha organizacin y de mucho mover las cosas de un lado a otro habamos logrado un par de cosas.
translation_reference: And about two years later, about a year later,  after a bunch of organization  and a bunch of moving things around,  we'd accomplished a couple things.
translation_hypothesis: And about two years after, close to one year after, after a lot of organization and a lot of moving things around, we had achieved a couple of things.

source: Una, tocamos a las puertas de las compaas de seguros y conseguimos una mquina para que TEMPT pudiera comunicarse; una mquina como la de Stephen Hawking.
translation_reference: One, we battered down the doors of the insurance companies,  and we actually got TEMPT a machine  that let him communicate -- a Stephen Hawking machine.
translation_hypothesis: One, we knocked on the doors of the insurance companies and got a machine so TEMPT could communicate; a machine like Stephen Hawking's.

source: Lo cual fue genial.
translation_reference: Which was awesome.
translation_hypothesis: Which was great.

source: Y, en serio, es de lo ms divertido; Yo le llamo Yoda porque al hablar con el tipo uno recibe un correo electrnico de l, y uno se dice: "No lo merezco. Este tipo es fantstico".
translation_reference: And he's seriously one of the funniest -- I call him Yoda,  because you talk to the guy, you get an email from him,  and you're like, "I'm not worthy. This guy's so amazing."
translation_hypothesis: And seriously, it's the funniest thing; I call it Yoda because when you talk to the guy you get an email from him, and you say, "I don't deserve it. This guy's fantastic."

source: La otra cosa que hicimos fue traer a siete programadores de todo el mundo -literalmente de todos los rincones del planeta- a nuestra casa.
translation_reference: The other thing we did  is we flew seven programmers from all over the world --  literally every corner of the world --  into our house.
translation_hypothesis: The other thing we did was to bring seven programmers from all over the world—literally from all corners of the planet—to our house.

source: Mi esposa, los nios y yo, nos mudamos al garage de atrs y estos hackers y programadores y conspiradores y anarquistas tomaron el control de la casa.
translation_reference: My wife and kids and I moved to our back garage,  and these hackers and programmers  and conspiracy theorists and anarchists took over our house.
translation_hypothesis: My wife, the children and I, moved into the garage of atrs and these hackers and programmers and conspirators and anarchists took control of the house.

source: Muchos de nuestros amigos pensaron que hacamos algo totalmente estpido y que cuando regresramos habran quitado los cuadros de las paredes y en su lugar habra graffiti.
translation_reference: A lot of our friends thought we were absolutely stupid to do that  and that we were going to come back  and all the pictures on the wall would be removed and graf on the walls.
translation_hypothesis: Many of our friends thought that we did something totally stupid and that when we return they will have removed the pictures from the walls and instead there will be graffiti.

source: Pero durante dos semanas programamos, fuimos al paseo martimo de Venice, mi hijo fue parte, mi perro tambin, y creamos esto.
translation_reference: But for over two weeks,  we programmed,  we went to the Venice boardwalk,  my kids got involved,  my dog got involved,  and we created this.

source: Se llama EyeWriter [EscritorOcular, NT] y pueden ver la descripcin.
translation_reference: This is called the EyeWriter,  and you can see the description.
translation_hypothesis: It's called EyeWriter [Ocular Writer, NT] and you can see the description.

source: Son un par de gafas de sol baratas que compramos en el paseo martimo de Venice Beach, algo de alambre de cobre y cosas de Home Depot y Radio Shack.
translation_reference: This is a cheap pair of sunglasses  that we bought at the Venice Beach boardwalk,  some copper wire  and some stuff from Home Depot and Radio Shack.

source: Tomamos una cmara PS3, la abrimos, la montamos sobre una luz de LED y ahora hay un dispositivo que es gratis -lo construye uno mismo; publicamos el cdigo gratis- el software se baja en forma gratuita.
translation_reference: We took a PS3 camera, hacked it open,  mounted it to an LED light,  and now there's a device that is free --  you build this yourself, we publish the code for free,  you download the software for free.

source: Y creamos un dispositivo que no tiene limitacin en lo absoluto.
translation_reference: And now we've created a device  that has absolutely no limitations.
translation_hypothesis: And we created a device that has no limitation at all.

source: No hay compaa de seguro que diga "no".

translation_hypothesis: There's no company for sure that says "no."

source: No hay hospital que pueda decir "no".

translation_hypothesis: There's no hospital that can say "no."

source: Cualquier persona con parlisis hoy tiene acceso a dibujar y comunicarse usando slo sus ojos.
translation_reference: Anybody who's paralyzed now has access  to actually draw or communicate using only their eyes.
translation_hypothesis: Anyone with parlysis today has access to drawing and communicating using only their eyes.

source: Gracias.

translation_hypothesis: Thank you.

source: As, al final de las dos semanas regresamos a la habitacin de TEMPT.

translation_hypothesis: So, at the end of the two weeks we returned to the TEMPT room.

source: Me encanta esta foto porque sta es la habitacin de otra persona y esa es su habitacin.

source: Haba todo este bullicio y ajetreo durante la gran inauguracin.

source: Y luego de ms de un ao de planificacin, dos semanas de programacin, sesiones intensas de toda la noche, Tony volvi a dibujar por primera vez en siete aos.
translation_reference: And after over a year of planning,  two weeks of programming,  carb-fest and all-night sessions,  Tony drew again for the first time in seven years.
translation_hypothesis: And after more than a year of planning, two weeks of programming, intense sessions all night, Tony redrawed for the first time in seven years.

source: Y esta es una foto maravillosa porque este es el sistema de soporte de su vida y est mirando a travs del sistema de soporte de su vida.
translation_reference: And this is an amazing picture,  because this is his life support system,  and he's looking over his life support system.
translation_hypothesis: And this is a wonderful picture because this is the support system of your life and is looking through the support system of your life.

source: Le corrimos la cama para que pudiera ver.

source: Y colocamos un proyector sobre una pared del estacionamiento de afuera del hospital.
translation_reference: And we set up a projector  on a wall out in the parking lot outside of his hospital.
translation_hypothesis: And we put a projector on a wall in the parking lot outside the hospital.

source: Y l volvi a dibujar por primera vez frente a su familia y amigos -y se imaginarn lo que fue el sentimiento en el estacionamiento.
translation_reference: And he drew again for the first time,  in front of his family and friends --  and you can only imagine  what the feeling in the parking lot was.

source: Lo gracioso fue que tuvimos que irrumpir en el estacionamiento as que sentimos como si estuviramos legitimando el graffiti tambin.
translation_reference: The funny thing was, we had to break into the parking lot too,  so we totally felt like we were legit in the whole graf scene too.

source: Al final de esto l nos mand un correo electrnico y esto era lo que nos deca: "Esta fue la primera vez que dibujaba en siete aos.
translation_reference: So at the end of this, he sent us an email,  and this is what the email said:  "That was the first time I've drawn anything for seven years.
translation_hypothesis: At the end of this I sent us an e-mail and this was what we said: "This was the first time I drew in seven years.

source: Me senta como si hubiera estado bajo el agua y alguien finalmente viniera a rescatarme y me sacara de all para que pudiera respirar".
translation_reference: I feel like I had been held underwater,  and someone finally reached down  and pulled my head up so I could breathe."
translation_hypothesis: I feel like I've been underwater and someone finally comes to rescue me and pulls me out of there so I can breathe."

source: No es maravilloso?

source: En cierta forma ese es nuestro grito de guerra.

source: Eso es lo que nos mantiene en movimiento, desarrollando.

source: Alguien con este potencial artstico merece mucho ms.

source: Por eso estamos tratando de averiguar cmo mejorarlo y hacerlo ms rpido y robusto.

source: Armstrong tuite algo sobre nosotros y entonces, en diciembre, la revista Time nos reconoci como uno de los 50 mejores inventos de 2010, y fue realmente genial.

source: Lo mejor de todo esto -y esto es lo que termina de cerrar el crculo- es que en abril de este ao en el Geffen del MOCA en el centro de Los ngeles va a haber una exhibicin llamada "Arte en las Calles".
translation_reference: The coolest thing about this --  and this is what's completing the whole circle --  is that in April of this year,  at the Geffen MOCA in downtown Los Angeles,  there's going to be an exhibition called "Art of the Streets."

source: As que, bsicamente esta es mi idea: si ves algo que no es posible, hazlo posible.

translation_hypothesis: So, basically this is my idea: if you see something that's not possible, make it possible.

source: Nada de lo que hay en esta habitacin era posible -el escenario, la computadora, el micrfono, el EscritorOcular- nada era posible en cierto momento.
translation_reference: Everything in this room wasn't possible --  this stage, this computer, this mic, the EyeWriter --  wasn't possible at one point.

source: No soy programador, nunca hice nada con tecnologa de reconocimiento ocular; simplemente reconoc algo y me asoci con gente maravillosa para poder hacer que suceda.
translation_reference: I'm not a programmer,  never done anything with ocular recognition technology,  but I just recognized something and associated myself with amazing people  so that we could make something happen.

source: Y estas son las preguntas que quiero que todos nos hagamos todos los das cuando nos encontremos con algo que sintamos que hay que hacer. Si no es ahora, cundo? Y si no soy yo, quin?
translation_reference: And this is the question I want everyone to ask yourself  every single day  when you come up with something you feel that needs to be done:  if not now, then when? And if not me, then who?

source: Gracias muchachos.

source: Y pas 30 das comiendo solamente esto... divertido al principio, algo difcil en el medio, muy peligroso al final.

source: De hecho, en gran parte de mi carrera me he estado sumergiendo en situaciones en apariencia horribles con el nico objetivo de tratar. de examinar cuestiones sociales de maneras que resulten atractivas, interesantes, y, con suerte, analizarlas de una manera que se vean entretenidas y accesibles para la audiencia.
translation_reference: In fact, most of my career,  I've been immersing myself  into seemingly horrible situations  for the whole goal of trying  to examine societal issues  in a way that make them engaging, that make them interesting,  that hopefully break them down in a way  that make them entertaining and accessible to an audience.
translation_hypothesis: In fact, in much of my career I have been diving into seemingly horrible situations with the sole purpose of trying to examine social issues in ways that are attractive, interesting, and hopefully analyze them in a way that is entertaining and accessible to the audience.

translation_reference: And some of those drops of oil  had a particular combination of chemicals in them  which caused them to incorporate chemicals from the outside  and grow the drops of oil.

translation_reference: That could happen within the lifetime of a single organism,  whereas before they'd built these special information processing structures,  that would have had to be learned evolutionarily  over hundreds of thousands of years  by the individuals dying off that ate that kind of fruit.

source: Uno de los nios en su clnica podra distinguir entre 18 sinfonas antes de cumplir los 2 aos.

source: Cuando su madre puso uno de sus discos favoritos, l correctamente dijo: "Beethoven"
translation_reference: When his mother put on one of his favorite records,  he would correctly declare, "Beethoven!"
translation_hypothesis: When his mother put up one of his favorite albums, I correctly said, "Beethoven."

source: Pero Kanner tena una mala opinin de estas habilidades, afirmando cosas como que los nios estaban simplemente regurgitando lo que haban odo a sus padres pedantes, desesperados por ganar su aprobacin.
translation_reference: But Kanner took a dim view of these abilities,  claiming that the kids were just regurgitating things  they'd heard their pompous parents say,  desperate to earn their approval.

source: Como resultado, el autismo se convirti en fuente de vergenza para las familias, y dos generaciones de nios autistas fueron enviados a instituciones para su propio bien, convirtindose en invisibles para el mundo en general.
translation_reference: As a result, autism became a source of shame and stigma for families,  and two generations of autistic children  were shipped off to institutions for their own good,  becoming invisible to the world at large.
translation_hypothesis: As a result, autism became a source of shame for families, and two generations of autistic children were sent to institutions for their own good, becoming invisible to the world at large.

source: Sorprendentemente, no fue hasta la dcada de 1970 que los investigadores empezaron a probar la teora de Kanner de que el autismo era raro.
translation_reference: Amazingly, it wasn't until the 1970s  that researchers began to test Kanner's theory that autism was rare.
translation_hypothesis: Surprisingly, it was not until the 1970s that researchers began to prove Kanner's theora that autism was rare.

source: Lorna Wing, psicloga cognitiva de Londres, pensaba que la teora de las madres neveras de Kanner era bastante estpida.
translation_reference: Lorna Wing was a cognitive psychologist in London  who thought that Kanner's theory of refrigerator parenting  were "bloody stupid," as she told me.
translation_hypothesis: Lorna Wing, a cognitive psychologist from London, thought that Kanner's friggin' moms were pretty stupid.

source: Ella y su esposo John eran gente clida y afectuosa, y tuvieron una hija autista profunda llamada Susie.
translation_reference: She and her husband John were warm and affectionate people,  and they had a profoundly autistic daughter named Susie.
translation_hypothesis: She and her husband John were warm and affectionate people, and they had a deep autistic daughter named Susie.

source: Lorna y John saba lo difcil que era criar a una nia como Susie sin servicios de apoyo, sin educacin especial, y sin acceso a otros recursos sin un diagnstico.
translation_reference: Lorna and John knew how hard it was to raise a child like Susie  without support services,  special education,  and the other resources that are out of reach without a diagnosis.
translation_hypothesis: Lorna and John saba how difficult it was to raise a girl like Susie without support services, without special education, and without access to other resources without a diagnosis.

source: Para defender ante el Servicio Nacional de Salud de que se necesitaban ms recursos para los nios autistas y sus familias, Lorna y su colega Judith Gould decidieron hacer algo que se debera haber hecho 30 aos antes.
translation_reference: To make the case to the National Health Service  that more resources were needed for autistic children and their families,  Lorna and her colleague Judith Gould  decided to do something that should have been done 30 years earlier.
translation_hypothesis: To defend before the National Health Service that more resources were needed for autistic children and their families, Lorna and her colleague Judith Gould decided to do something that should have been done 30 years earlier.

source: Realizaron un estudio de prevalencia de autismo en la poblacin general.
translation_reference: They undertook a study of autism prevalence in the general population.
translation_hypothesis: They conducted a study of the prevalence of autism in the general population.

source: Peinaron un suburbio de Londres llamado Camberwell para tratar de encontrar a los nios autistas en la comunidad.
translation_reference: They pounded the pavement in a London suburb called Camberwell  to try to find autistic children in the community.
translation_hypothesis: They combed a London suburb called Camberwell to try to find the autistic children in the community.

source: Lo que vieron dej claro que el modelo de Kanner era demasiado limitado, pues la realidad del autismo era mucho ms colorida y diversa.
translation_reference: What they saw made clear that Kanner's model was way too narrow,  while the reality of autism was much more colorful and diverse.
translation_hypothesis: What they saw clearly was that Kanner's model was too limited, as the reality of autism was much more colorful and diverse.

source: Algunos nios no podan hablar en absoluto, mientras que otros estaban enfrascados en su fascinacin por la astrofsica, en los dinosaurios o en la genealoga de la realeza.
translation_reference: Some kids couldn't talk at all,  while others waxed on at length about their fascination with astrophysics,  dinosaurs or the genealogy of royalty.
translation_hypothesis: Some children could not speak at all, while others were caught up in their fascination with astrophysics, dinosaurs, or royal genealogies.

source: De otra forma, estos nios no encajaban en cuadros bonitos y aseados, como dijo Judith, y vieron un montn de ellos, mucho ms que el modelo monoltico de Kanner habra predicho.
translation_reference: In other words, these children didn't fit into nice, neat boxes,  as Judith put it,  and they saw lots of them,  way more than Kanner's monolithic model would have predicted.
translation_hypothesis: Otherwise, these children did not fit into pretty, neat pictures, as Judith said, and saw a montn of them, much more than Kanner's monoltic model would have predicted.

source: Al principio, estaban perdidos por intentar dar sentido a sus datos.
translation_reference: At first, they were at a loss to make sense of their data.
translation_hypothesis: At first, they were lost for trying to make sense of their data.

source: Cmo nadie no se haba percatado de estos nios antes?
translation_reference: How had no one noticed these children before?
translation_hypothesis: How come no one's ever noticed these kids before?

source: Pero entonces Lorna encontr una referencia a un artculo publicado en alemn en 1944, el ao siguiente al artculo de Kanner, y que luego se olvid, enterrado bajo las cenizas de un tiempo terrible que nadie quera recordar.
translation_reference: But then Lorna came upon a reference to a paper that had been published  in German in 1944,  the year after Kanner's paper,  and then forgotten,  buried with the ashes of a terrible time  that no one wanted to remember or think about.

source: Kanner saba sobre este artculo de la competencia, pero evit escrupulosamente mencionarlo en su propio trabajo.
translation_reference: Kanner knew about this competing paper,  but scrupulously avoided mentioning it in his own work.

source: No haba ni siquiera una traduccin al ingls, pero por suerte, el marido de Lorna hablaba alemn, y l lo tradujo para ella.
translation_reference: It had never even been translated into English,  but luckily, Lorna's husband spoke German,  and he translated it for her.

source: El documento ofrece una historia alternativa del autismo.
translation_reference: The paper offered an alternate story of autism.

source: Su autor era un hombre llamado Hans Asperger, que diriga una clnica integrada con una escuela internado en Viena en la dcada de 1930.
translation_reference: Its author was a man named Hans Asperger,  who ran a combination clinic and residential school  in Vienna in the 1930s.

source: Las ideas de Asperger para la enseanza de nios con diferencias de aprendizaje eran progresivas incluso para los estndares contemporneos.
translation_reference: Asperger's ideas about teaching children with learning differences  were progressive even by contemporary standards.
translation_hypothesis: Asperger's ideas for teaching children with learning differences were progressive even for contemporary standards.

source: Las maanas en su clnica empezaron con clases de ejercicios con msica, y los nios seguan sus juegos los domingos por la tarde.
translation_reference: Mornings at his clinic began with exercise classes set to music,  and the children put on plays on Sunday afternoons.
translation_hypothesis: The mornings in their clinic began with exercise classes with music, and the children followed their games on Sunday afternoons.

source: En lugar de culpar a los padres de causar autismo, Asperger la describi como discapacidad poligentica de por vida que requera formas compasivas de apoyo y espacios adaptados durante el transcurso de toda la vida.
translation_reference: Instead of blaming parents for causing autism,  Asperger framed it as a lifelong, polygenetic disability  that requires compassionate forms of support and accommodations  over the course of one's whole life.
translation_hypothesis: Instead of blaming parents for causing autism, Asperger described it as life-long polygenetic disability that requires compassionate forms of support and adapted spaces throughout the lifetime.

source: En lugar de tratar a los nios en su clnica como pacientes, Asperger los llam sus pequeos profesores, y se dedic a ayudar en el desarrollo de mtodos de educacin que fueran especialmente adecuados para ellos.
translation_reference: Rather than treating the kids in his clinic like patients,  Asperger called them his little professors,  and enlisted their help in developing methods of education  that were particularly suited to them.
translation_hypothesis: Instead of treating the children in their clinic as patients, Asperger called them his little teachers, and dedicated himself to helping in the development of methods of education that were especially suitable for them.

source: Fundamentalmente, Asperger vio el autismo como un continuo diverso que abarcaba una sorprendente variedad de dones y discapacidad.
translation_reference: Crucially, Asperger viewed autism as a diverse continuum  that spans an astonishing range of giftedness and disability.
translation_hypothesis: Fundamentally, Asperger saw autism as a diverse continuum encompassing a surprising variety of gifts and disability.

source: l crea que el autismo y los rasgos autistas eran comunes y siempre lo han sido, viendo aspectos de este continuo en arquetipos conocidos en la cultura pop como el cientfico social torpe y el profesor distrado.
translation_reference: He believed that autism and autistic traits are common  and always have been,  seeing aspects of this continuum in familiar archetypes from pop culture  like the socially awkward scientist  and the absent-minded professor.
translation_hypothesis: He believes that autism and autistic traits were common and have always been, seeing aspects of this continuum in archetypes known in pop culture as clumsy social scientist and distracted professor.

source: l fue ms all incluso hasta decir, que para el xito en la ciencia y el arte, una pizca de autismo es esencial.
translation_reference: He went so far as to say,  it seems that for success in science and art,  a dash of autism is essential.
translation_hypothesis: It was more all even to say, that for success in science and art, a pinch of autism is essential.

source: Lorna y Judith descubrieron que Kanner estaba equivocado en que el autismo era infrecuente, as como en que los padres eran los causantes.
translation_reference: Lorna and Judith realized that Kanner had been as wrong about autism being rare  as he had been about parents causing it.
translation_hypothesis: Lorna and Judith discovered that Kanner was wrong that autism was rare, as well as that the parents were the cause.

source: En los siguientes aos, trabajaron en silencio con la Asociacin Estadounidense de Psiquiatra para ampliar los criterios del diagnstico que reflejaran la diversidad de lo que llamaron "espectro autista".
translation_reference: Over the next several years,  they quietly worked with the American Psychiatric Association  to broaden the criteria for diagnosis  to reflect the diversity of what they called "the autism spectrum."
translation_hypothesis: In the following years, they worked quietly with the American Association of Psychiatrists to broaden the diagnostic criteria that reflected the diversity of what they called "autistic spectrum."

source: A finales de los 80 y principios de los 90, sus cambios entraron en vigor, sustituyendo el modelo limitado de Kanner por uno amplio e inclusivo de Asperger.
translation_reference: In the late '80s and early 1990s,  their changes went into effect,  swapping out Kanner's narrow model  for Asperger's broad and inclusive one.
translation_hypothesis: In the late 1980s and early 1990s, its changes came into effect, replacing Kanner's limited model with a broad and inclusive Asperger model.

source: Estos cambios no cayeron en saco roto.
translation_reference: These changes weren't happening in a vacuum.
translation_hypothesis: These changes did not fall into a broken sack.

source: Casualmente, cuando Lorna y Judith trabajaban entre bastidores para reformar estos criterios, personas de todo el mundo vean un adulto autista por primera vez.
translation_reference: By coincidence, as Lorna and Judith worked behind the scenes  to reform the criteria,  people all over the world were seeing an autistic adult for the first time.
translation_hypothesis: Casually, when Lorna and Judith worked behind the scenes to reform these criteria, people around the world see an autistic adult for the first time.

source: Antes de que saliera "Rain Man" en 1988, solo un pequeo crculo, encarnado por expertos saba qu era el autismo, pero tras la inolvidable actuacin de Dustin Hoffman como Raymond Babbitt y el reconocimiento de "Rain Man" con 4 premios de la Academia, pediatras, psiclogos, maestros y padres de todo el mundo saban qu era el autismo.
translation_reference: Before "Rain Man" came out in 1988,  only a tiny, ingrown circle of experts knew what autism looked like,  but after Dustin Hoffman's unforgettable performance as Raymond Babbitt  earned "Rain Man" four Academy Awards,  pediatricians, psychologists,  teachers and parents all over the world knew what autism looked like.
translation_hypothesis: Before "Rain Man" came out in 1988, only a small circle, embodied by experts knew what autism was, but after Dustin Hoffman's unforgettable performance as Raymond Babbitt and the recognition of "Rain Man" with 4 Academy awards, pediatricians, psychologists, teachers and parents from all over the world knew what autism was.

source: Al mismo tiempo, se introdujeron las primeras pruebas clnicas fciles de usar para diagnosticar el autismo.
translation_reference: Coincidentally, at the same time,  the first easy-to-use clinical tests for diagnosing autism were introduced.
translation_hypothesis: At the same time, the first physical clinical tests to be used to diagnose autism were introduced.

source: Ya no deba tener una conexin con ese pequeo crculo de expertos para lograr un diagnstico para su hijo.
translation_reference: You no longer had to have a connection to that tiny circle of experts  to get your child evaluated.
translation_hypothesis: You should no longer have a connection with that little expert circle to get a diagnosis for your child.

source: La combinacin de "Rain Man" los cambios en los criterios y la introduccin de estas pruebas crearon un efecto de red, una tormenta perfecta de la conciencia del autismo.
translation_reference: The combination of "Rain Man,"  the changes to the criteria, and the introduction of these tests  created a network effect,  a perfect storm of autism awareness.
translation_hypothesis: The combination of "Rain Man" the changes in the criteria and the introduction of these tests created a network effect, a perfect storm of autism consciousness.

source: El nmero de diagnsticos empez a elevarse, al igual que predijeron Lorna y Judith, de hecho esperaban que as fuera, logrando que las personas con autismo y sus familias finalmente obtuvieran el apoyo y los servicios que se merecan.
translation_reference: The number of diagnoses started to soar,  just as Lorna and Judith predicted, indeed hoped, that it would,  enabling autistic people and their families  to finally get the support and services they deserved.
translation_hypothesis: The number of diagnoses began to rise, as Lorna and Judith predicted, in fact they expected it to be, getting people with autism and their families finally to get the support and services they deserve.

source: Entonces Andrew Wakefield lleg a culpar a las vacunas por el aumento en los diagnsticos. Una simple, poderosa, y seductora historia creble tan mala como la teora de Kanner de que el autismo era infrecuente.
translation_reference: Then Andrew Wakefield came along  to blame the spike in diagnoses on vaccines,  a simple, powerful,  and seductively believable story  that was as wrong as Kanner's theory  that autism was rare.
translation_hypothesis: So Andrew Wakefield came to blame the vaccines for the increase in diagnostics. A simple, powerful, and seductive creble story as bad as Kanner's theora that autism was rare.

source: Si la estimacin actual del centro de prevencin de que 1 de cada 68 nios en EE.UU. estn en el espectro, es correcta, los autistas son uno de los grupos minoritarios ms grandes del mundo.
translation_reference: If the CDC's current estimate,  that one in 68 kids in America are on the spectrum, is correct,  autistics are one of the largest minority groups in the world.
translation_hypothesis: If the current estimate of the prevention center that 1 out of every 68 children in the U.S. are in the spectrum is correct, autistics are one of the largest minority groups in the world.

source: En los ltimos aos, las personas autistas se han unido en Internet para rechazar la idea de que son los puzzles por resolver por los nuevos avances mdicos, acuando el trmino "neurodiversidad" para celebrar las variedades de la cognicin humana.
translation_reference: In recent years, autistic people have come together on the Internet  to reject the notion that they are puzzles to be solved  by the next medical breakthrough,  coining the term "neurodiversity"  to celebrate the varieties of human cognition.
translation_hypothesis: In recent years, autistic people have come together on the Internet to reject the idea that they are the puzzles to be solved by the new medical advances, when the term "neurodiversity" to celebrate the varieties of human cognicin.

source: Una manera de entender la neurodiversidad es pensar en trminos de sistemas operativos humanos.
translation_reference: One way to understand neurodiversity  is to think in terms of human operating systems.
translation_hypothesis: One way to understand neurodiversity is to think about human operating system terms.

source: El hecho de que una PC no funcione con Windows, no significa que est rota.
translation_reference: Just because a P.C. is not running Windows doesn't mean that it's broken.
translation_hypothesis: The fact that a PC doesn't work with Windows doesn't mean it's broken.

source: Segn los estndares autistas, el cerebro humano normal es fcilmente distraible, obsesivamente social, y sufre de un dficit de atencin a los detalles.
translation_reference: By autistic standards, the normal human brain  is easily distractable,  obsessively social,  and suffers from a deficit of attention to detail.
translation_hypothesis: According to the autistic standards, the normal human brain is easily distracted, obsessively socially, and suffers from a deficit of attention to detail.

source: Sin duda, las personas autistas tienen dificultades para vivir en un mundo no construido para ellos.
translation_reference: To be sure, autistic people have a hard time  living in a world not built for them.
translation_hypothesis: Without a doubt, autistic people have difficulty living in a world not built for them.

source: 70 aos ms tarde, todava estamos alcanzando a Asperger, que crea que la "cura" para los aspectos ms incapacitantes de autismo se encuentran en la comprensin de los maestros, empleadores con capacidad, comunidades de apoyo, y los padres con fe en el potencial de sus hijos.
translation_reference: [Seventy] years later, we're still catching up to Asperger,  who believed that the "cure" for the most disabling aspects of autism  is to be found in understanding teachers,  accommodating employers,  supportive communities,  and parents who have faith in their children's potential.
translation_hypothesis: 70 years later, we are still reaching Asperger, who believes that the "cure" for the most incapacitating aspects of autism are found in the understanding of teachers, capable employers, supportive communities, and parents with faith in the potential of their children.

source: Una mujer autista llamada Zosia Zaks dijo una vez: "Necesitamos todas las manos en cubierta para enderezar el barco de la humanidad".
translation_reference: An autistic [man] named Zosia Zaks once said,  "We need all hands on deck to right the ship of humanity."

source: Mientras navegamos hacia un futuro incierto, necesitamos todas las formas de inteligencia humana en el planeta para hacer frente a los desafos que enfrentamos como sociedad.
translation_reference: As we sail into an uncertain future,  we need every form of human intelligence on the planet  working together to tackle the challenges that we face as a society.

source: No podemos permitirnos desperdiciar ni un cerebro.
translation_reference: We can't afford to waste a brain.

source: Gracias.
